sub_title: Hardware Engineer - EMJMD Smart Systems Integration Almuni
summary:
I am an Electrical Engineer with a strong foundation in Control Systems, Industrial Electronics, Embedded Systems, Hardware designing, Sensors and Actuators, and the Internet of Things due to working on distinct projects. I have a good command of C, C++, Python, VHDL, and Verilog programming. I have a deep understanding of CAD, CAM, and 3D printing and also organized and conducted skill-based workshops on designing CAD models using SolidWorks. I have the potential of integrating myself in dissimilar environments due to my vast travel experience.

With the knowledge of numerous programming languages and work experience in diversified domains like industrial, research and academic sector, I want a challenging research position in a leading organization where I can utilize my interpersonal and engineering skills and knowledge with academic learning, and gain useful experience that would bolster my technical abilities and professionalism.

projects.title: FPGA based Airbag Deployment System for Volkswagen Tiguan 2009
projects.description:
- Fulfilling the dynamic response of the accelerometer sensors placed in VW Tiguan 2009 for airbag deployment.
- Frequency measuring system to avoid jerks that arise when sensors get an impulse. The system was able to differentiate between the real and fake accident values.
- Communication with the Master control system through UART and providing interrupt signal in case of an accident. The system provides additional troubleshooting capability to tune the sensor values.
- The system was implemented on Quartus II for RTL synthesis and the response time was within the range.

contributors.headline: Hardware Engineer - EMJMD Smart Systems Integration Almuni

projects.title: FPGA based Smart Elevator System
projects.description:
- Implementation of Collective-Selective / Up-Down algorithm using VHDL programming.
- Weight sensors on floors provide light optimization and overloading.
- Floor sensors and door sensors were used for locking the elevator for safety purposes.
- Heat sensors provide information if the elevator can stop on a certain floor or not in case there is a fire emergency on a certain floor.

contributors.headline: Hardware Engineer - EMJMD Smart Systems Integration Almuni

projects.title: Design and Fabrication of an Acoustic Tractor Beam System for Object Levitation
projects.description:
The project realizes the ultrasonic levitation system used in industrial applications for placing SMD components on the PCB board without touching the object itself to reduce the ESD problems.
- The Ultrasonic system was realized using COMSOL simulations and then the results of the simulations were used to design the mechanical hardware to get the maximum acoustic radiation force for levitation of the object and placing it in the desired location over the PCB.
- The project uses FPGA to control the phases of 49 transducers to levitate the object and can implement the Twin trap, vortex, and both configurations at the same time. The twin trap system was implemented using an electronic PCB to amplify signals from FPGA and provide it to transducers to work on the required frequency with the required power for the levitation of the object.

projects.title: IoT based Air Pollution Monitoring System
projects.description:
The main features of the project are:
- A portable device that can collect the data of temperature, humidity, harmful gases such as LPG, hydrogen, methane, carbon monoxide and alcohol in the environment.
- A user friendly mobile application from where it can monitor the current environmental conditions, store the data and provide daily and monthly reports to the user.

profile_positions.description:
- Developed various PCB designs including flex PCBs, 8 and 10-layer FPGA-based PCBs with high speed and differential pair signals.
- Ensured validation of PCBs before document transfer to production.
- Responsible for incoming inspection of PCBs and cables.
- Completed Test and Validation of various sub-systems.
- Tasked to create work instructions of sub-systems along with checks that are easy to follow for smooth development of systems.
- Identified various bugs during production and provided possible solutions.
- Completed Corrective action and preventive action for error-free development of cables used in the system.
- Responsible for the completion of various work packages in a timely fashion.
- Worked alongside the Quality department to acquire MDD and MDR certifications.
profile_positions.title: Hardware Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Solving torque and position control of a Myoelectric Prosthetic Hand.
- Designed feedback using an encoder and potentiometer-based solution for position control.
- Calculation of torque using pressure sensors along with current consumption.
- Compliance of products with biocompatibility, ISO, IEC, and FDA standards for medical devices.
- 3D modeling and printing using SolidWorks for desired components used in the project. 
- Microcontroller software development using C language.
- Implemented Motion control on collected EMG signal data with Python-based Machine Learning on beagle bone.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Student

profile_positions.description:
- Reduced electrostatic discharge (ESD) problem in the manufacturing process by implementing Acoustic levitation through transducer intensity control.
- Firmware development on FPGA controller (DE2 ALTERA CYCLONE 2) using VHDL.
- Performance improvement via PCB design and signal diagnosis by oscilloscopes, multimeter, and other testing devices.
- Acquired desired concentrated acoustic intensity by developing a 3D printed transducer holder on SolidWorks.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

profile_positions.description:
- Improved throughput of FPGA-based 64-bit RISC-V processor by pipelining and forwarding unit using Verilog.
- Boosted academic and industrial relationships as a Lead member of the Student Success Committee (SSC).
- Enhanced students’ technical capabilities by Conducting skill-based workshops.
- Taught courses including Computer Architecture and Electronics Circuit Design.
profile_positions.title: EE Academic Performance Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Optimized Product Development by managing 5 group members and distributing tasks among them.
- Improved Traffic Light control system from PLC-based design to FPGA-based scalable design.
- Developed LabVIEW-based upper limb exoskeleton to enhance rehabilitation process of stroke and orthopedic patients.
- Rapid Prototyping and product encapsulation using 3D modeling and printing using SolidWorks.
- PCB development for analog and digital circuits for the embedded solutions, debugging, and electrical troubleshooting.
- Firmware development on microcontrollers using python and C language.
- Equipment and signals testing using oscilloscopes, function generators, logic analyzers, and other testing devices.

volunteer_experiences.description:
- I assisted in solving positioning problem of Intelitek SCORBOT-ER 4u by analyzing motion of the system and designing an encoder disk that enabled precise calculation for position steps using a decoder. Hence, the feedback to the sensors was corrected automation line problem was resolved.
- Another machine was Metkon GRIPO 2V-a grinding and polishing machine – I designed new gear using the previous damaged gear to restore the original movement of the machine.
As a director of Media and Design in IEEE-PNEC, I was monitoring the work and guiding the students for designing and promotion content and promoting it on social media and around campus.

- As a director of Media and Design in AIR-PNEC, I was monitoring the work and guiding the students for designing and promotion content and promoting it on social media and around campus.
- I was also a key organizer in "Mock Interviews" to prepare students in their upcoming job interviews. The mock (preparatory) interviews were taken by the Alumni of PNEC NUST who were working in industries.
- The other major event was NUST Alumni Homecoming Event in which we contacted the Alumni and organized a dinner for Alumni so to make strong bond between students of PNEC with their graduates.
